comments: Open enrollment class sessions are offered throughout the year, generally at a monthly cadence. To confirm upcoming class dates, please refer to our course schedule located at https://www.microassist.com/classroom-training/course-schedule/
description: Students will learn the process to remediate and test a PDF document for accessibility issues to make the content meet WCAG 2.0 Level AA success criteria, which will be able to meet PDF/UA standards with no unintentional warnings or errors. Participants will also be given advanced items to remediate.
platforms: Online Instructor Led Sessions are hosted using Zoom.
prerequisites: To ensure your success in this course, you should have a working knowledge of the Adobe Acrobat Pro DC platform and knowledge about accessibility concepts. You can obtain these skills by taking the Testing & Remediation Strategies for PDF Accessibility: Intermediate Edition course.
title: Testing & Remediation Strategies for PDF Accessibility: Advanced Edition
